result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody D. Pacyna Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.11.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber if approved by the jail administration.
First 100 days in jail, second half on electronic monitor if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $3,238.65.  Must pay at least $150 per month towards restitution.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Work fulltime.  Can go to school parttime in addition to that.  Work fulltime until restitution is paid.

No contact with the victims, Brenda and Tyler Pikus with the exception of writing a letter of apology to the victims within 30 days.  Submit to agent to review and forward. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Early discharge allowed after 18 months, if and only if, he is in complete compliance and paid full restitution.
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor.
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

First 5 days in jail, last 5 days on electronic monitoring.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: **AMENDED** /S/ ttf 05/24/17 - last name of victim changed

Defendant Cody D. Pacyna Rodriguez in court with attorney Acalia Halverson appearing for Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State files Victim Impact Statement. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 3 & 4 are dismissed and read-in. 

Court reviews the Victim Impact Statement.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Counts 1 & 2: 
200 days jail on each count, concurrent with one another - STAYED -
Huber if approved by the jail administration.
First 100 days in jail, second half on electronic monitor if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Early discharge allowed after 18 months, if and only if, he is in complete compliance and paid full restitution.
Serve 10 days jail.  
Sentence to commence within 60 days of todays date. 
First 5 days in jail, last 5 days on electronic monitoring. 
1 day credit.
40 hours community service
Pay restitution of $3,238.65.  Must pay at least $150 per month towards restitution.  
No contact with the victims, Brenda and Tyler Pikus with the exception of writing a letter of apology to the victims within 30 days.  Submit to agent to review and forward. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Work fulltime.  Can go to school parttime in addition to that.  Work fulltime until restitution is paid.  
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
Court grants expungment under 973.015.

records.addlTxt: Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  * Tyler Pikus *. Court orders to go to public defender's office to seek representation.

Defendant Cody D. Pacyna Rodriguez appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty  Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:26 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court does have the criminal complaint.

Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant has read the complaint, waives reading of complaint.

Court advises Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Defendant would like to talk to an attorney.

Court will enter a NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of Defendant.

Address is verified.
Defendant lives with his father, is unemployed, graduated from high school this year.

State addresse bond.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
